title: Loss is negative? Reproducing MapNet on RobotCar `loop` dataset
body:
1. After setting up the environment as this repo describes, I train MapNet on `loop` dataset from scratch by running
```python
python train.py --dataset RobotCar --scene loop --config_file configs/mapnet.ini --model mapnet --device 0 --learn_beta --learn_gamma
```
After that, I get the model `logs/RobotCar_loop_mapnet_mapnet_learn_beta_learn_gamma/epoch_300.pth.tar ` and evaluate the model on `loop` but the result seems not as good as the paper reported. Do you have any suggestions?
```bash
$ python eval.py --dataset RobotCar --scene loop --config_file configs/mapnet.ini --model mapnet --weights logs/RobotCar_loop_mapnet_mapnet_learn_beta_learn_gamma/epoch_300.pth.tar --val --output_dir ../results/

../dataset_loaders/robotcar_sdk/interpolate_poses.py:143: RuntimeWarning: divide by zero encountered in divide
  (pose_timestamps[upper_indices] - pose_timestamps[lower_indices])
Loaded weights from logs/RobotCar_loop_mapnet_mapnet_learn_beta_learn_gamma/epoch_300.pth.tar
Running mapnet on VAL data
../common/train.py:339: UserWarning: volatile was removed and now has no effect. Use `with torch.no_grad():` instead.
  data_var = Variable(data, volatile=(not train), requires_grad=train)
Image 0 / 3356
Image 200 / 3356

Error in translation: median 150.43 m,  mean 142.86 m
Error in rotation: median 57.09 degrees, mean 77.71 degree
```

2. BTW, a strange phenomenon is that the training loss is negative. As the attachment shows: [log.txt](https://github.com/NVlabs/geomapnet/files/2735585/log.txt)
